post.title: What is your opinion of restaurants that ban children?

body: I support adult centric places banning children, like nice restaurants and bar & grill type places. Adults need an escape sometimes.
body_html: I support adult centric places banning children, like nice restaurants and bar & grill type places. Adults need an escape sometimes.

guild.name: AskRuqqus

post.title: What is your opinion of restaurants that ban children?

body:
Good for them. It's their restaurant, their property, their choice. If you don't want to go to a restaurant that bans children, don't go there. 

As for me, If I'm spending $40-80 on the entre` alone, no, I do not want my dining experience ruined by someone's screaming, ill-behaved child. 

Lets also talk about the selfishness and entitlement of some parents. Do you really think your 2 yo is going to enjoy going to a restaurant with linen table clothes, fine crystal, and a separate wine list? Or do you think they'll be bored out of their mind? Why would you do that to your kid? Children aren't meant to learn how to use the right fork at 2, or even 5/6 yo. Part of being a parent is realizing it's not about You anymore. It's about the kid. You, as the adult, have to make accommodations and give up certain things when you become a parent. Your life becomes child-centric. It's just fact.

The people around you, however, did not chose to have Your child, and therefore, do not owe your child any accommodations. That's not their responsibility--it's Yours. Take the responsibility and either don't go to a nice restaurant, or quit being a cheapskate and hire a babysitter.
body_html:
Good for them. It's their restaurant, their property, their choice. If you don't want to go to a restaurant that bans children, don't go there.

As for me, If I'm spending $40-80 on the entre` alone, no, I do not want my dining experience ruined by someone's screaming, ill-behaved child.

Lets also talk about the selfishness and entitlement of some parents. Do you really think your 2 yo is going to enjoy going to a restaurant with linen table clothes, fine crystal, and a separate wine list? Or do you think they'll be bored out of their mind? Why would you do that to your kid? Children aren't meant to learn how to use the right fork at 2, or even 5/6 yo. Part of being a parent is realizing it's not about You anymore. It's about the kid. You, as the adult, have to make accommodations and give up certain things when you become a parent. Your life becomes child-centric. It's just fact.

The people around you, however, did not chose to have Your child, and therefore, do not owe your child any accommodations. That's not their responsibility--it's Yours. Take the responsibility and either don't go to a nice restaurant, or quit being a cheapskate and hire a babysitter.

body: If you can't manage a respectable hair style (read: "not blue") and to dress yourself in real (not stretchy) pants, you may not be ready for fine dining just yet. Maybe stick to avacado toast at your local brunch haunt.

post.title: What is your opinion of restaurants that ban children?

body:
I witnessed an adult temper tantrum on a date at a restaurant that explicitly states "No Children's Menu" and "Dress Code Required" out front.  They might have fit in at a Buffalo Wild Wings, but certainly not at that place.

It was the closest I've ever come to witnessing "and then everyone clapped".  There were a lot of subtle nods and thumbs up flashed at the hostess.
body_html:
I witnessed an adult temper tantrum on a date at a restaurant that explicitly states "No Children's Menu" and "Dress Code Required" out front. They might have fit in at a Buffalo Wild Wings, but certainly not at that place.

It was the closest I've ever come to witnessing "and then everyone clapped". There were a lot of subtle nods and thumbs up flashed at the hostess.

post.title: What is your opinion of restaurants that ban children?

body:
As long as it's well known ahead of time and not embarrassing people at the door, then I'm fine with it.  I just don't want to show up with a family event to a restaurant and learn at the door that they don't allow the kids.  

I'm too picky about the food, more so than the atmosphere.  Nothing pisses me off more than paying a place to serve me old shitty food.
body_html:
As long as it's well known ahead of time and not embarrassing people at the door, then I'm fine with it. I just don't want to show up with a family event to a restaurant and learn at the door that they don't allow the kids.

I'm too picky about the food, more so than the atmosphere. Nothing pisses me off more than paying a place to serve me old shitty food.

post.title: What is your opinion of restaurants that ban children?

body:
I own and run a restaurant that allows kids, we even have a great kids menu with coloring in and pencils to try and keep them entertained. 
As of this September, we are banning children under 10 because of the appalling behavior of a lot of families which disturb other customers. 
It is slack parents who are to blame for not controlling their kids, not the restaurants fault for preserving the rights of other diners.
body_html: I own and run a restaurant that allows kids, we even have a great kids menu with coloring in and pencils to try and keep them entertained. As of this September, we are banning children under 10 because of the appalling behavior of a lot of families which disturb other customers. It is slack parents who are to blame for not controlling their kids, not the restaurants fault for preserving the rights of other diners.

post.title: What is your opinion of restaurants that ban children?

body: I'm OK with this as long as we can also ban people without children from child-centric places like arcades, Disneyland, and kid films. Kids are annoying but as a parent, adults who scowl at me because my son is eating his popcorn too loud while watching Toy Story 4 are just as fucking bad.
body_html: I'm OK with this as long as we can also ban people without children from child-centric places like arcades, Disneyland, and kid films. Kids are annoying but as a parent, adults who scowl at me because my son is eating his popcorn too loud while watching Toy Story 4 are just as fucking bad.
